Black Ops III is often acclaimed the “best zombies” in the Call of Duty franchise. And I give it that credit. The workshop support and DLC maps, Zombie Chronicles, really makes for a great bundle. On the workshop you will find a variety of different maps far varying in quality. I do have one particular gripe with this game’s zombies and it is the weapons. This can be fixed with mods, but I believe that the weapon selection, especially in zombie chronicles is cool, yet out of place in most of the settings provided, having a cyberpunk feeling in mostly Cold-War and WW2 era maps. But moving on from Zombies, the multiplayer is really not worth going at in 2025. The crate system is in full blast on this game and it is absolutely an insufferable cash grab. 
For the campaign, I personally viewed it as confusing, cringe at times, yet some parts were entertaining. The campaign does feel like a huge downgrade from Black Ops 1, and Black Ops 2.
For the most part, I do recommend this game, but really only for the zombies. I also recommend the map “Black Mesa: Biodome” on the workshop.

BEHOLD
our beloved black ops 3 with, undeniably, the best zombies experience. Why? well, take a look at the workshop yourself and feast your eyes upon the thousands of mods available whenever you feel like it; World at War, Black ops 1, Black ops 2 or any call of duty map that you enjoy you will very likely find in this game's workshop and often times it will have even MORE content that the original one does such as weapons from other call of duty games making the experience just that little bit more fun. This doesn't just mean that you will only find maps from other call of duty games as there is a vast selection of maps created from fantasy or based off other things that you may enjoy such as TV shows or other games. As somebody who has played this game for years, I can tell you that this game has done more for the community than just be a game... the late night conversations while playing this, the hang outs with friends while playing this, all the fun memories while playing THIS. Overall the game itself without mods feels great too and there is lots of fun to be had with the DLC maps and with the DLC weapons you can get and with the bubblegums in this game. At first, we may not have been as happy with black ops 3 as we are now because it brought many new things that we took some time getting used to but now looking back at those times, this is another one of those games that I wish I could experience all over again. To be honest, this whole review may be a bit of a nostalgia trip however I'd like to put this out there anyway as I'm sure that a lot of people can relate to chasing the feelings that games like this gave us. Black ops 3 is worthy of all nighters, hundreds of hours of game time and definitely more fun with friends. As a fellow gamer, I do recommend that you wait until it is on sale and that you have a decent computer so that you can experience this game as intended which in my opinion transcends the newer call of duties. Is it worth it? yes. You may want to stay away from multiplayer with random people though.

Black Ops 3 Zombies is still one of the most enjoyable and addictive modes I have ever played in a shooter. Even after all these years, the gameplay feels smooth, fast, and incredibly satisfying. Every map has its own atmosphere and personality, and the variety keeps the game exciting every time you load it up.

The highlight for me is how well the maps mix challenge and fun. You are constantly moving, training zombies, completing steps, and trying to survive one more round. The mechanics feel tight and responsive, and the weapons are extremely fun to use. The Pack a Punch upgrades, the GobbleGum system, and the different strategies all make each run feel different.

What I love the most is the replay value. You can spend hours and never feel bored. Whether you are trying to hit a high round, complete an Easter egg, or just play with friends, the mode always delivers. It is also surprisingly rewarding to learn the layout of the maps and figure out the fastest paths, the safest spots, and the little tricks that help you survive longer.

The atmosphere is another strong point. The soundtrack, the sound effects, and the map designs create a tense but exciting vibe. Some maps feel dark and intense, while others feel more adventurous or mysterious. It keeps the experience fresh even after countless matches.

Overall, Black Ops 3 Zombies is the peak of the series for many players, and I completely agree. It is fun, deep, challenging, and incredibly replayable. If you enjoy zombies mode in any Call of Duty game, this one absolutely deserves a perfect score.

Yeah… I guess this was around the time they started making strange decisions and mistakes with this franchise, I would argue the newer games are significantly better than this, but… who am I, right?

The campaign is whatever, you get to create your character out of 20 same looking white guy presets. Then Christopher Meloni shows up? And he’s a bad guy? What the fuck.

The multiplayer is fine, I wanted to play bot mode offline but even if the game includes an option to play offline in the main menu, it locks you out of playing bots offline for reasons… you need a separate “non official” mod for that, and I’m not doing that for numerous reasons frankly… I ended up trying bots on the easiest setting while online and they were still a pain in the ass!

Zombies is where this game is at, heck, you even get remastered maps by simply getting the base version, and most of the DLC content advertises the zombie mode of the game rather than the multiplayer maps for example. There’s even mod support in the form of steam workshop and there are some awesome maps people have made… but this mode has never really been that interesting for me, so… I still didn’t find the pull here for me personally.

So yeah… this was just a big disappointment for me, only people who I would recommend this game to is Zombie COD fans, so if you love that mode, you’ll love this game because is the only real functional part of it frankly, and it's not even because of the mode itself but because of how freaking well the community has supported it, they even added offline bots to the mode... something that I guess Activision with its billions of dollars couldn't be bothered to do.

EDIT: +set fs_game usermaps

Putting that command right there starts the game in "mod" mode and lets you play offline with bots, fantastic, fantastic news.

If you are planning on playing this game solo or locally, Black Ops 3 is quite possibly the best zombies game out there. Other modes like multiplayer is alright, and the campaign is sub-par compared to previous titles in the series (i.e. black ops 1 & 2).

However, if you decide to play this game with any form of human interaction, look elsewhere. To play Zombies or any other mode without the looming threat of having your PC compromised, you will have to acquire third party programs that fix what Treyarch/Activision should have ages ago (and still haven't to this day). If you play without those programs, anyone can boot you from the game, steal vital information, and ruin the experience entirely- this is all to say even if you try playing in a "private" lobby. Others can randomly join simply by clicking a button in a list.

This is my favorite game for its workshop within zombies. It has always stuck with me but I cannot recommend this game, even now, as Treyarch have dropped the ball on programs that help players who simply don't want to be hacked while trying to enjoy the game they bought for 60 dollars (mind you this game came out 10 years ago).

Id say get it while it is on sale and be careful.

Zombies are great and the custom maps that the community are developing for this game, are just perfect.

But I just cannot recommend this game for several reasons:

 - There are security problems, you are completely exposed to cyber-criminals when looking for a public match, either in zombie mode or multiplayer mode. There are methods to circumvent this, such as the BO3Enhanced, but relies on community efforts and so it's not included in the base game, nor the price.

 - Stuttering issues, specially while navigating the menus. Again BO3Enhanced solves this. 

 - Dead multiplayer. Depending where you live, there is a small chance that you will find a lobby with player, but they are usually half full and there is a high chance that you find hackers on it. This also makes it really hard, if not impossible, to complete all the achievements in the game.

 - Campaign feels poorly developed.

 - Microsoft/Activision didn't give a **** to update and fix the game on the rest of platforms, they only fixed it on microsoft store, and only because they are including it now with gamepass.

And any of these arguments wouldn't be a reason to not recommend this game, if it wasn't for the price. Paying 59,99 for the Zombies Chronicles Edition, for a 10y old game that has this many problems... is just a joke to me. You can get it for 19,79 on discount, but still feels like too much to me.

It's like Activision either cares too much about money, or doesn't care about their fans and COD franchise at all.
